text: Hey Jon, looking into this now. Can you reproduce this consistently or does it happen randomly?

it seems pretty consistent
1.clone module from portal A to portal B
2. in portal B move module to new folder, delete old containing folder that was copied from portal A
3. in portal A copy another module to portal B
4. congrats, your second module and any assets have left the atmosphere. They are findable in the search, but in the finder they do not exist and neither does their containing folder. Thus you can’t move them, and they are like ghost files, invisible in the finder.
I have not tried moving the asset out, will try now
step 2 moving the module, may not be necessary to reproduce, but deleting the folder is
Way way back <@U9WG7DMHB> helped me recover some files that this happened to, he might be able to provide some additional info
Okay I got it to reproduce by moving the file out

way back I think Aizhan said that basically folders when they were deleted in the new design manager basically flipped a boolean that determined whether the folder showed. and basically the copying of an item from another portal into that same folder does not trigger the folder to become flipped back on
Interestingly enough I can’t reproduce unless I move the asset out of the folder. I wonder if it’s not generating a new id or a duplicate id and just overriding the moved filed.
